answerText: EDTA [or ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid; or Y; or diaminoethane-tetraacetic acid; or edetic acid; or ethylenedinitrilo-tetraacetic acid; or Versene][10] EDTA can be used in this analytical technique to determine the amount of calcium and magnesium in hard water. This technique is more commonly performed with standardized acids or bases, an indicator, and a burette.
heading: ACF Regionals |2013 | Schindler + Yale C + Minnesota B | 16 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Although it is capable of shedding up to 6 hydrogens, the amide hydrogens on this compound are generally not lost unless it is in basic solution. For 10 points each: [10] Name this hexadentate ligand and popular chelating agent.
